content.question:
Let f be the function defined by f(x) = excos(x).

(a) Find the average rate of change of f on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadIhacqGHKjYOcqaHapaCaaa@3CD0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
Let f be the function defined by f(x) = excos(x).

(a) Find the average rate of change of f on the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGimaiabgs MiJkaadIhacqGHKjYOcqaHapaCaaa@3CD0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) What is the slope of the line tangent to the graph of f at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>π</mi> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D79@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
(c) Find the absolute minimum value of f on the interval 0 ≤ x ≤ 2π. Justify your answer.

(d) Let g be a differentiable function such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>π</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F0D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The graph of g', the derivative of g, is shown below. Find the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mi>π</mi> <mo>/</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48C8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> or state that it does not exist. Justify your answer.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
